content: You would think this would ring a bell. . . for anyone who has spent years setting in cubicles and meeting rooms. It is really difficult to do that if what you are really doing doesn’t really need to be done. But somehow this is a very difficult idea to get across. Yes, it is not about money but about what you can accomplish but I’m growing more and more concerned that the idea of accomplishing something other than increasing the size of the paycheck has been leached out or us all in the post industrial world. And the rest of the population gathering trash, teaching, and policing are struggling to expand their credit card debt so they can have more of that shit they don’t need. But they know that this is a zero sum game, even if they don’t know what that means, because those other pieces of foreign shit are stealing theirs. So screw working to give those assholes more. Understand I totally agree that UBI is the key to any future at all. I just don’t know now how to get there without some very serious revolutionary changes happening. Telling people to just give up what they have fought all their lives to get so they can have less and enjoy it more sounds like something Donald Trump would say so he could buy another gold toilet.
